column4: Hi. I have a Thinkpad T60 next to me. I upgraded from 8.04 to 9.04. This caused screen hangs, after a downgrade of the xorg-video-driver.
Without finding a solution I went for a 8.10 reinstall.
I did this without formatting the drive.
On boot, the laptop doesn't show a login screen.
Xorg.0.log suggests several points of failure.
without formatting the drive? hmm...that could cause no end of excitement. do you not have a separate /home?
*Apparently* I was a wang when I installed this one, and forgot to create a separate partition for /home/
I then went and did the same thing again with the new install, actually, forgetting to create a second partition (though I didn't fancy dynamic resizing)
simplest to backup your data, do the reinstall, and then restore, i think.
However xubuntu install *did* warn that it would blow away /var/, /lib/, /etc/ etc.
So it seemed vaguely sane to try installing over the top.
I'm doing a mostly slow backup now, but wanted to look for alternatives.
didn't think they made those anymore. no clickable scroll wheel?
Since I use a datahand, I need a static mouse between the hands.
does pressing both buttons simultaneously emulate button 3?
Not now. Used to. I can fix with xinput set-prop on the device, I guess.
